intro: Conchocarpus transitionalis, commonly known as the transitional conchocarpus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, spherical fruits. The botanical features of this plant make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
